newsitem.title: USA: U.S. corn weekly export sales highlights - USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. corn weekly export sales highlights - USDA.

text.p: USDA corn export sales highlights in latest reporting week:

Net sales of 593,200 MT fell one-fifth from the previous week and 16 percent from the 4-week average. The principal purchasers were Japan (261,100 MT, reflects 234,300 new sales, 54,900 destination changes, 28,100 cancellations) Taiwan (115,600 MT), Saudi Arabia (57,600 MT, reflects new sales of 2,600, destination changes 55,000), Venezuela (50,000 MT), and Algeria (49,300 MT).
Sales activity of 121,400 MT for the 1997/98 marketing year were mainly for Japan (89,400 MT).

Exports of 1,004,400 MT were two-fifths above the prior week and one-quarter over the 4-week average. Japan (542,800 MT) was the leading destination, followed by Taiwan (166,000 MT), Saudi Arabia (87,600 MT), South Korea (52,800 MT), and Algeria (49,300 MT).
